subject: Education
title: Automated Grading: Fair or Flawed?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Automated Grading: Fair or Flawed? usable.

hook.text: An AI graded an essay as excellent. The essay was gibberish with sophisticated vocabulary.

buildup.text: Automated essay scoring (AES) promises to reduce grading workload from days to seconds.

discovery.text: AES systems can match human graders on well-structured prompts with 85-90% agreement.

twist.text: They can be gamed: students learn to write for the algorithm, not for understanding.

climax.text: The best use combines AI for first-pass feedback with human review for high-stakes decisions.

punchline.text: Machines can grade words. Only humans can grade thinking.

quiz.question: What is a key vulnerability of automated essay scoring?
options: Students can game the system by writing for the algorithm instead of for understanding
It cannot process essays longer than 100 words
